sentence.Network_en: Clare did not deserve the vilification she had been subjected to.
sentence.Network_cn: 克莱尔不该受到这样的诽谤。

sentence.Network_en: They pelted him with ridicule and vilification.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们用嘲笑和丑化对他进行猛烈的攻击.

sentence.Network_en: Bishop's letter was the signal for a campaign of vilification and intimidation unequaled in American history.
sentence.Network_cn: 主教的信是发动一场在美国历史上没有前例的诬蔑和恐吓运动的信号.

entry.def: If you are vilified by someone, they say or write very unpleasant things about you, so that people will have a low opinion of you.

example.ex: The agency has been vilified by some doctors for being unnecessarily slow to approve life-saving drugs...
example.tran: 该机构因对救生药物的审批速度太慢而备受一些医生的诟病。

example.ex: He was vilified, hounded, and forced into exile by the FBI.
example.tran: 他遭到了联邦调查局的诬蔑和追捕，被迫流亡国外。

means.word_mean: 2. a rude expression intended to offend or hurt;

sentences.sentence: "when a student made a stupid mistake he spared them no abuse"
"they yelled insults at the visiting team"

auth_sentence.content: In the meantime, the global bullying campaign and the hysterical vilification of the man and his character has to stop.
auth_sentence.res_content: In the meantime, the global bullying campaign and the hysterical vilification of the man and his character has to stop.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In the meantime, the global bullying campaign and the hysterical vilification of the man and his character has to stop.

auth_sentence.content: Whether or not the former Lib Dem chief executive deserves this level of vilification remains to be seen.
auth_sentence.res_content: Whether or not the former Lib Dem chief executive deserves this level of vilification remains to be seen.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Whether or not the former Lib Dem chief executive deserves this level of vilification remains to be seen.

auth_sentence.content: Former chair of the commission Dame Helena Shovelton resigned after saying media coverage amounted to a personal vilification.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Former chair of the commission Dame Helena Shovelton resigned after saying media coverage amounted to a personal vilification.
